inn1.comm: short and wide and he goes after it, not as much bounce as he expected, slashes hard, misses
short and wide, connects this time, slashes it hard into the ground but straight to point
more on a good length this time, in the channel outside off, shoulders arms to leave it through
back of a length on middle, rocks back and turns it towards midwicket
in the corridor again, a bit of width but Smith's not taking risks yet, leaves it be
back of a length on the off, stands tall and knocks it down in front of point, starts off with a maiden
short of a good length outside off, Shivnarine Chanderpaul drops his hands on that one and lets it through
back of a length on the off, gets back and punches it towards extra cover
much fuller this time, on a good length just around off stump, steps forward with a closed face and taps it back down the pitch
held it back this time, rising up well to Chanders who drops it in front of the bowler, disciplined stuff so far from the Irish
short of a good length on middle, accurate, on middle and off, Chanderpaul gets back and presents the full face
a touch fuller, on middle and leg, pushes Chanders back and he meets it with a firm defence into the leg side, but two maidens in a row
slightly short on middle, gets on the back foot and drops it into the leg side
back of a length again, pushed back and Smith, though firm in defence, is yet to open his account
lands on a good length this time, times it well trying to push it towards mid-on
first runs for the Windies, short of a length, it's chopped down behind point towards third man for a single
pushing it through on middle and leg, Chanders shuffles a hint and works it towards midwicket
short of a good length outside off, gets on the back foot and taps it in front of extra cover
forces it off the back foot, not much room being provided here, gets back and punches it to extra cover
getting it to nip in just a hint, draws the batsman forward this time, defended solidly towards the bowler
nicely timed, shortish and a bit of width, Smith rocks back and just eases it between cover and point, came off the meat, nicely placed
much fuller, strayed in line slightly there, on middle and leg, turned away but straight to midwicket
pitches it up just a hint and Smith pushes it firmly in the direction of mid-off
Rankin bowls it full on Chanders' pads, tickled away behind square wide of fine leg for a couple of runs, off the mark is Chanders
lovely drive from Chanders, lands on a good length and he just eases into the drive, cracking it between extra cover and mid-off
pitched up on middle, driven firmly down the ground but mid-on does well, diving to his right to save a couple of runs
lands on a good length on the off, gets across and knocks it towards cover
back of a length outside off, shoulders arms to that one
struck on the pads, a touch too high, drew him forward with that good-length delivery, tried to close the face did Chanders but missed, was struck outside the line as well
back of a length from round the wicket, gets back and jabs it to midwickt
a bit more effort on that one from Cusack, short and wide and he goes for the cut, misses
a fraction overpitched but Smith can't beat the infield, driven firmly but straight to mid-off
goodish length outside off, in that channel, gets forward, opens the face and guides it to third man for a single
short of a good length outside off, keeps a fraction low this time, Chanders leaves it be
superbly timed, good length on middle, gets forward, closes the face and punches it down the ground, past the bowler and the diving mid-on, gradually getting into his groove here
it's driven back firmly towards Rankin who fields well on his follow-through
angling it away from the legt-hander, good length and Smith tries to caress that one through extra cover, beats the swing of the bat does Rankin, the keeper fumbles and concedes a run
chopped down towards third man for a single
accurate line from Rankin, on middle and off, did not provide any width this time and Smith could only defend it back to the bowler
short of a good length outside off, stands tall and chops it down to third man
short of a good length in the corridor, left alone to the keeprr
short of a length on middle, gets on the back foot to tap it wide of midwicket for a single
short ball on the off stump, punched firmly towards mid-off
goodish length on the off, gets forward and knocks it in front of point
slightly short on middle, Chanders gets on the back foot and dabs it towards midwicket
short of a good length, tries to force it off the back foot past mid-off, does not connect well enough, rolls down to that fielder
slower one bowled full on the off, driven down towards mid-on, another quiet over, good stuff
good length on middle and off, gets forward and pushes it towards extra cover
pitched on a good length and there's a bit of width this time, tries to cream it through cover but doesn't make contact
fullish on middle, gets across, closes the face and pushes it back to the bowler

excellent fielding by Dockrell at third man, it flew off the outside edge as Smith slashed hard at that one, Dockrell moved to his right, his wroing side, and dived full length to palm it inside the ropes and restrict them to a couple
short of a good length, carried well to the keeper, just a fraction outside off there, couldn't free his arms there, left alone
short of a good length on middle and off, pushed away into the off side
slower one bowled full on middle and leg, pushed back down the pitch

dropped, Smith charges forward and cracks that hard towards extra cover, Stirling's perfectly placed there but it came at him quickly and he was unable to react quickly enough, tried to take it over his head but couldn't hold on. A tough chance but we've seen them being taken
drops it on the leg side and Chanders has no trouble helping it on its way to the fine-leg boundary
pushing it full on the off side, tries to drive through the line, gets a thick inside edge and wide of midwicket for a single
angles it towards middle and off, Chanders gets across to work it past midwicket, gets a thick leading edge as he turns the face a little too early, a single down to third man
on a good length towards middle, worked away towards midwicket
fullish on the off, he's bowling it much fuller than the others, gets forward and pushing it towards mid-off
back of a length on middle, gets back and turns it away wide of square leg for a single
shortish on the off, gets back and knocks it down in front of extra cover
short on middle, punched off the back foot towards mid-off
edged, lands on a good length, was trying to swing it away over midwicket, the length wasn't quite right for that shot, produces an edge and third man is a little wide, four streaky runs
pushed it fuller on middle, mistimes an attempt flick towards midwicket
slower one there, cut away after landing on a good length, placed behind point for a single
slower one driven down the ground to mid-off, Rankin scores a direct hit at the non-striker;s end off a needless throw, they get a single off the ricochet
bowled on a length on middle, pushed uppishly past the bowler towards long-on for a single
bowled it full outside off, it's square-driven but straight to the fielder at point
round the wicket, on a good length, keeps its line, tries to smack it through cover but can't connect
goodish length on the off, pushed down towards mid-off, not the happiest man right now is Smith, the pressure's building gradually
a single through cover, just pushed through the gap and into the deep
slightly short on the off, gets across and works it away through square leg for a single
beaten, good length again and he tries to drive it through extra cover, fails to make contact yet again
pitched up outside off, leans into the drive does Chanders but finds Stirling at extra cover
nicely timed, pushed through firmly down the ground but mid-off runs to his left, tumbles and keeps them to a single
slower one bowled short on the off, chopped down towards third man for a single
short of a good length on middle and off, can only squeeze it to cover
shortish on the off, opens the face and guides it down to third man for a single
pushed down towards mid-off off the front foot, pitched up on the off
Aiming for the blockhole and almost gets it right, digs it out towards mid-off
knocks it down behind point to sneak a quick single
round the wicket to Chanders, on middle and leg, pushed past the vacant midwicket region for a single
short of a good length on the off, knocks it down in front of point
a goodish length this time, gets forward and plays it to cover

Smith finally connects well, short ball, a touch too short and it;s there for the taking, rocks back and pulls it fiercely to beat deep midwicket to the boundary, 50 up for the Windies, it's been difficult but they're there without any damage
slower one bowled short on the off, mistimes a punch towards cover
pitched up on the off, driven towards extra cover
tries to open the face there to squeeze a single to third man but  ends up playing it in front of the wicket
pitched up and Chanders sense a chances, drives it well but mid-off dives to his right to keep it down to just a single
strays on the pads, turned away past square leg for a single
cramping him for space there, on middle, Chanders pushes it back to the bowler
four, four, full and Smith finds the gap, picks it well off the length and beats the diving mid-on fielder to find the boundary
good length on middle, gets forward and defends it solidly back to the bowler
short ball outside off, guides it down to third man for a single
shortish outside off, tries to be a little cheeky, aiming for a late cut there but can't connect
it was the legcutter from round the wicket, gets forward and defends it with bat close to pad
short of a good length outside off, cut away towards third man for a single
short of a good length on the off, dropped in front of point
short of a good length outside off, cracked straight to point off the back foot
good length on middle, presents the full face as he drives it back to the bowler
still can't beat the infield, excellent fielding at cover point as the fielder dives full length to his left, just the single
pushed down the ground to long-on for one more
driven through the line wide of long-off for a couple more
connects superbly, trying to get a move-on now, pitched on a length and he picks it well, depositing it over long-on for a meaty six
misses out this time, short ball on the off, pulled hard but straight to midwicket
slower one, the offcutter, on a good length on the off, defended in front of point
shortish on the off, pushed through towards extra cover
slower one bowled full on middle, drives it firmly but can't beat midwicket
shortish outside the off stump, the slower one bowled from round the wicket, run down to third man to keep the strike
eased down towards long-off for a comfortable single
slower one bowled short on middle, took forever to get to Chanders, mistimes it back to the bowler
short of a good length on middle and leg, whipped to midwicket
slower one bowled short outside off, runs it down to third man for a single
slower one again, provides a bit of width this time, chopped towards point
short on middle, pushed that past the bowler in the direction of long-on
short of a good length outside off, runs it down delicately to third man for a single
goodish length on the off, pushed uppishly but gets to the extra cover fielder on the bounce
holding back the pace again, on a length around off stump, pushed gently to cover
manages to squeeze that past the fielder at cover for a single
big backlift there, tries to crack it down the ground past the bowler, can't quite connect well, mistimed
slower one bowled on a good length on middle and leg, pushed down towards long-on for a single
shortish outside off, cuts it down past point into the deep for a single
loopy full toss on middle, punched down towards long-on for one more
shortish on the off, gets back and forces it to cover
keeping it tight on middle and off, gets forward and defends it back to the bowler
fullish on middle, driven back to the bowler
and again, tossed up, bowled full again, presents the full face but it's back to Stirling
on a good length on middle, pushed down to long-on for a single
short ball on middle, turned away to midwicket off the back foot
slower one bowled short outside off, cut down to third man for a single
closes the face, fetches it from the off stump to glance it down to fine leg
short of a good length, nudged down towards point
slower one bowled short on the off, punched off the back foot to extra cover
tossed up on middle, driven straight to midwicket
goodish length from round the wicket, steps forward and pushes it to cover
fullish on middle, driven down the ground to long-on for a single

streaky way to get to a half-century, comes down the track to deposit that over long-on, trying to force the issue, was fortunate to get an inside edge past the short-fine fielder for a boundary, a laborious half-century to ODI standards
swings it over midwicket this time but didn't time it well, long-on runs across and cuts it off
short ball outside off, chopped down towards point
short ball outside off, swats it down the track to long-on and there's a shocking misfield by Rankin there, shocking because it's from an Irishman, concedes an extra run
O'Brien has struck, a soft dismissal in the end, pitched up on the off and Chanderpaul drives it uppishly to find Porterfield at extra cover who takes a good, low catch
good ball first up to the new man, aiming for the yorker, almost gets it right, dug out into the leg side, almost caught him on the shoe there
full on middle, driven back confidently to the bowler, offers the full face
Gone! Timber! Full on middle and Bravo senses a chance, meaty delivery and he tries to blaze it down the ground, misses and the middle stump is out of the ground
full outside off, driven sweetly but straight to cover, that over just spiced things up after a not-so-exciting run of play
short of a good length on the off, pushed towards extra cover
straight on middle, makes a bit of room and chops it behind point for a single to third man
angling in towards middle and leg, lands on a length, Sarwan closes the face just a hint and drives it to mid-on
short of a good length on middle and leg, turned away to fine leg for a single
slower one bowled short on the pads, tries to whip it square, is struck on the thigh, they squeeze a leg bye
low full toss on the off, driven straight to extra cover

that didn't miss the leg stump by much, short of a good length, tried to chop it behind point, got an inside edge down to fine leg...or so we thought, that wasn't an inside edge but two byes, it was Niall O'Brien who fumbled
too short and it's dealt with, dropping it short outside off and Smith swings it away to find that gap between long-on and deep midwicket
low full toss on middle, driven down to long-on for a single
raises the pitch with a single to mid-on, pitched up and it's met with a gentle push
full toss on middle and leg, tickles it down to fine leg
the offcutter, bowled it full outside off, it's square-driven to point
ooh, almost dragged it on, short of a good length and was looking to cut, got an inside edge onto his pads
stifled appeal for lbw, good length on middle and leg, tried to hit it through the line, missed, was struck a little high on the pad and the angle would have probably taken it down leg, no referral
pitched up on the off, driven to mid-off
goodish length on middle and leg, tries to whip it square, struck high on the pads again, gets a leg bye
misdirected and pays the price, full on leg stump and it;s tickled really fine, beat short fine leg to the ropes
short of a good length, punched to extra cover
slightly short on middle, turned away wide of square leg for a single
slowed it up, shortish outside off, tries to dab it past point, misses
goodish length outside off, drags it towards midwicket, can't  beat the infield

short outside off, cut away towards deep point for a couple of runs, it's a direct hit from the deep and they take another one off the ricochet, they've referred it to the third umpire but he was miles in
back of a length on leg stump, off the thigh as he tries to work it to fine leg
short outside off, cut down to third man for a single
comes down the track and tries to attack him straightaway, aiming to deposit him over midwicket, is struck on the pads
it pays off this time, flighted and he accepts the challenge, comes down and smacks him with the turn over midwicket to find the gap
bowled flat on middle, turned away to midwicket
drops it gently in front of point, Sarwan calls and races through comfortably to the other end
full on middle, driven towards midwicket
tossed up on middle, gets across and turns it down to midwicket
short and wide outside off, cracked away to deep point for a single
Sarwan steps up, made room, that was pitched on a length, was in the slot for the man and he smashed it over mid-on for a one-bounce four
short of a good length outside off, dabbed down to third man for a single
tight line this time, good length on middle, gets on the back foot and defends to extra cover
whipped off the back foot past midwicket into the deep for a single
the legcutter, bowled from back of the hand, guided down to third man for a single
flat but on a length, struck down to long-off for a single
fortunate is Smith, comes down the track to smash him over long-off, was much slower through the air, had a wild swing, got an outside edge and luckily for him it beat short third man
bowled flat on the pads, flicked through square leg into the deep for a single
saw him come down, held it back and bowled it flat, Sarwan offered the pad after dancing down the track
fullish on middle, driven down to midwicket

Sarwan holes out, Dockrell strikes, tossed up and he was tempted, wasn't much intent in that shot however, was aiming at that gap between long-off and deep extra cover but didn't go where he intended, landed straight into the hands of Mooney at long-off
beaten, good length outside off and there was a bit of movement off the pitch away from the batsman, Pollard fished for it and almost paid the price
short of a good length on middle, rocks back to defend it back towards the bowler
short on the off, gets back and just drops it into the leg side hoping for a quick single but it's not there
beaten again, a bit of movement away from the batsman and Pollard pushed inside the line to that one
thick outside edge, ooh, there is a slip in place and Ireland would have sensed a chance, was the slower one, went down safely to third man
nipped back in, Smith tried to cut that when there wasn't really much room, almost chopped it on but it bounced over the stumps, excellent over
well what happens is...he bowls it short outside off and it's cut down to deep point for a couple of runs
flat, and short on middle, punched down past the bowler for a single
slowed it up and went straight on, Smith was playing for the turn and defended inside the line, missed
fires it down the leg side, called a wide
short outside off, swatted down the track to long-on for a single
gentle one on leg stump and Pollard tries to treat it gently, looking to close the face and nudge it for a single, clips the pads and they take a leg bye
struck hard and flat but on the bounce to long-off, Smith wants to step it up now
bowled it short outside off, cut away down to third man for a single
Pollard drives it uppishly, just wide of the outstretched arm of Rankin and on the bounce to mid-off
walks across to flick it over square leg this time, is struck on the pads but well outside the line, another leg bye
short of a good length on middle, defended in front of point for a quick single
good length on the off, pushes it wide of mid-off for one more
short ball outside off, chopped down to point, Rankin continues to do a good job
short outside off, slapped down the ground to long-off for a single
there is a fielder in the deep on the leg side but this evades him comfortably, comes down the track does Smith and picks it him over mid-on
slowed it up, the offcutter bowled slightly short outside off, cut down to point
well kept, good take behind the stumps by Niall O'Brien but it's down the leg side and a wide
good length on the off, pushed down the ground to long-off for a single
slower one bowled full outside off, dug out towards point

cashing in here, that was a poor ball from Mooney, short ball down the leg side and Smith had no trouble helping it to the fine-leg boundary, that was a freebie. The bowler admonishes himself, and rightly so
slower one bowled short outside off, dragged towards square leg
length ball and Pollard sends it into the stands, on middle and he picks it up beautifully, effortless shot, just a flick and it flies away over deep midwicket
missed run-out, flicked to square leg and Mooney misses a direct hit as Pollard takes off for a single, he's sent back and he had no chance, missed opportunity for the Irish there
banged it short on middle, the slower one, tries to pull it fine, misses out
another slower bouncer, Pollard had anticipated that, targeted the deep midwicket boundary there but didn't connect
another length ball, that's a crime to bowl to Pollard there, lofted it with absolute ease over long-on, the Irish are slipping up in the Powerplay
driven down towards long-on for a single

dropped, that was another chance missed, Pollard, trying to fkicl it over square leg, gets a leading edge and Wilson at long-on ran yards to his left to pouch that but wasn't able to clasp it in the end, dived forward but didn't judge it well
punched off the back foot to long-off for a single
misfield at point by Stirling, an innings-turing phase this, short and wide and it's cut, he dived over it and conceded four
fullish on the pads, flicked away through square leg into the deep for a couple of runs
Pollard made a bit of room and the bowler chased him, he dabbed it behind point for a quick single
in the blockhole but outside off, dug out towards mid-off for a single
short and it's punished, rocks back after picking the length early and hammers it over midwicket, raises the 50-stand in quick time
bowled on a length and gets the same treatment, drilled down the ground for another four, made a bit of room and it was smashed back
banged in short again, pulled to deep square leg for a single
short and wide, cut away to point for a quick single, his maiden ODI hundred, the helmet comes off and his team-mates stand to applaud
pushed past the bowler in the direction of mid-off for a single
fatal fumble in the deep, tickled off the pads, Cusack gives chase from short fine leg, slips and then loses his balance again to concede four runs, are West Indies running away with it here?
mistimes it, swung over midwicket for a couple of runs, Kevin o'Brien didn't pick it in the deep
fires it down the leg side, Pollard misses, the bowler is lucky to get away there, wasn't called a wide
short ball outside off, dabbed it in front of point for a single
good length on the off, pushed in front of extra cover for a quick single
shortish on middle, whipped through square leg for a single
four more, full outside off, cheekily done by Pollard there, third man is a little wide, opened the face at just the right time to beat that fielder
full outside off and it was in the slot, that's blazed down to long-off for a single
tickled through square leg for a single
four more, slower one bowled full and even though he mistimed it he found the gap, found the gap between long-on and deep midwicket with a slog
they are maining the runflow even after the Powerplay's done, steered wide of third man for a couple more runs
Pollard gets to his half-century with a drive through midwicket, runs back for a couple, he's put his team on course for a big score now
short on middle, pulled away to deep square leg for a single
good length outside off, sliced it wide of point into the deep for a couple of runs
short and wide, cut away uppishly towards deep point for a single
full and wide, reaches for it attempting to slice it over point, can't get to it, called a wide
low full toss, he gets an inside edge as he tries to drive it towards long-off, sneaks a quick single

They've called for a review. Landed on a good length on the off and was coming in with the angle, Smith moved well across to flick it square, was struck on the pads, but the impact was outside the off stump. The appeal is turned down, Ireland call for a referral and replays show the impact was outside off. No change in decision.
a one-handed swipe to midwicket
lovely delivery, in the blockhole on middle, can only manage to dig it out into the leg side
shuffles way too much in an attempt to flick it fine, it's fired full on the stumps and he misses, timber! The end of an innings Devon will remember for the rest of his life.
starts with a boundary, short ball on the pads and he has no trouble working it away to the fine-leg boundary
the slower legcutter, nips away after landing short of a good length, Sammy chases it but can't connect

a wicket Ireland needed badly, though it's not Pollard. Sammy can step it up but he finds fine leg, short on middle and leg and he swivels to play the pull, gets a top edge and Dockrell makes no mistake in the deep
banged in short on middle, takes his eyes off as he pulls it, gets a single down to fine leg
shortish outside off, pushed from the crease to point
gets a big stride out as he tries to defend, gets an inside edge on the pads - they called for a referral have Ireland. Replays show there was a massive inside edge
short of a good length on middle, pushed it back towards the bowler
pushes it wide of mid-off for a single
full outside off, reaches for it and gets a thick outside edge to third man, a couple more, good couple of overs for Ireland
short of a good length outside off, nipping away, fishing for it and misses
good length on the off, gets forward, taps it in front of mid-off for a quick single
banged it short outside off, a touch too high or so it seemed, gears up for the pull but misses
good length on the off, made room to crack it down to long-on for a single
a swing and a miss, Devon Thomas isn't doing much from the other end
gone, slightly back of a length and it rose up well, Thomas tried to dab it to third man, gets a thin edge straight to the keeper, Ireland have fought back in these last few overs
shortish outside off, makes room and chops it to point for a single
back of a length on middle, punched towards point
short of a good length on middle, dabbed it into the leg side for a single
found the gap, shaped himself up for a pull pretty early there and received the right delivery, short outside off and he thrashes it over midwicket, almost fell away as he played it
follows that up with a ferocious six, short on the off and he targets the deep midwicket boundary again and clears it with ease
drills it down the ground to long-off for a single
almost a yorker there, dug it out towards extra cover, keeps the strike does Pollard
short on middle, pulled away towards deep square leg for a single
short and wide, makes room to crash it through point, misses, there was a sound but no one went up
short and wide and he tries to dispatch that through the off again, misses, Pollard's the man, needs to give him the strike
short on middle, smacked towards long-on for a single
edged and four, good length and it wasn't quite there for the blazing drive he was attempting through cover, he went at it hard and it flew off the edge to the third-man boundary
full outside off, mistimes a drive to long-off for a single
low full toss, reaches for it and drives it wide of extra cover, races back for the second as long-off runs to his left and cuts it off
slower one dropped short outside off and it's hammered, swatted mercilessly to the long-off boundary
a crowd-killer, dropping short, they've done that too often against him and he murdered it over midwicket for a flat six
a one-handed six, his hand came off the handle, landed on a length on middle and he deposited it comfortably over deep midwicket, on course for a century now
keeps the strike with a drive to extra cover

Misses the century as he holes out to long-off, length ball and just the right delivery he needed to get to that landmark, but he didn't connect as well as he would have liked, lofted it straight to long-off

bowled'im, full on middle and leg, Russell has a wild swing and not for the first time, misses. The leg stump is uprooted and the umpire just wants to check again if it was a no-ball. Replaus show it wasn't, an Russell, pretty unhappy with himself, has to go
the hat-trick ball is a full toss outside off, steered towards deep point for a single
good length on middle, turned away towards deep midwicket for a single
slower one bowled short outside off, gets an inside edge as he tries to punch it through the off side
slower one short outside off, run down to third man for a single
good length on th eoff, pushes it back to the bowler

dropped, slower one bowled full on middle, smashed back to the bowler who spills it after not reacting in time, but as they attempt the second, Mooney returns a neat throw to the bowler who takes off the bails to find Benn short
played down the ground to long-on for a single
slower one bowled full outside off, steered behind point for a single
shortish on middle, pushed towards cover for a single
swings hard but miscues it to point, was targeting long-off there but went far from it, West Indies have been bowled out

inn2.comm: 144.5 kph to start off business, back of a length and angling into line with leg, Porterfield gets behind it and defends
away in edgy fashion, Roach is cranking it up already. 147 kph, fuller length on middle and off, seeking the drive, Porterfield pokes uncertainly and squeezes through point for one
back of a length outside off and he leaves it through to the keeper
Stirling is away, hanging back and angling the face to pick up a single to third man
fuller length, Porterfield times the flick well off the back foot but finds square leg
good start from Roach, not a single bad delivery. Short of a length on off stump, Porterfield covers the line and defends
full length on middle and leg, driven back to the bowler

shot from Stirling. Benn tosses it up generously outside off, Stirling leans out to the pitch and goes uppishly on purpose. He times it well enough to get over mid off and get the boundary. Just over.
shortens the length this time, Stirling hangs back and defends

gone. Was the appeal for lbw? Might have been. Umpire de Silva has given it out, and Stirling is most definitely out caught. Back of a length on off and breaking away, he stays back and tries to turn it to the leg side. Huge inside edge, onto the pad and caught on the off side. Easy as they come.
Lovely hit. Two sublime fours sandwich a dot ball and the dismissal. Tossed up outside off, again inviting the drive and Joyce drills through the line for four through cover point.

whoa, some over this. Another boundary, making it 12 for 1 off Benn's first over. Flighted again well outside off, he wants edges, and Joyce doesn't give him an edge. He middles it with fluent a drive into the covers
back of a length and on the pads, tucked through midwicket for a single

nearly another lbw. This time the inside edge saves him. Lands back of a length and nips in from off stump, this is what Roach does best. Joyce doesn't adjust for the deviation and pokes outside the line. Inside edge thuds into the pads.
short of a length on the stumps, at 148 kph, Joyce stays behind the line and defends
shorter this time, Joyce camps on the back foot and keeps it out with a solid defensive stroke

that's Roach's first bad ball today, and Joyce and dismissed it for his third four. Full and fast, missing the line by a few inches and ends up on the pads. Joyce skips inside the line and daintily glances to fine leg
better line, closer to middle this time, and Joyce plays a little around the front pad to keep it out
Flight on off stump, Porterfield presses out to defend down the track
this one comes in with the turn, Porterfield flicks through midwicket and gets a single
right, so Joyce is not going to hit everything from Benn for four. He gets half forward to cover the deviation and defend a length ball down the track
nicely done, he hangs back to a delivery marginally short of length and nurdles with precision through square leg for a couple
tossed up on middle and leg, worked off the front foot to midwicket
this time Benn slips down the leg side for a wide

could Joy be the man today? Another spanking cover drive, he's hitting them with rare Gowereque sweetness today. Flighted outside off again, without protection in the deep, Joyce smoothly lays into it through the covers
short of a length on off stump, Porterfield stays behind the line and defends to the off side

alright, this is a quick start despite the early wicket. Porterfield gets marginally inside the line of an over-pitched leg stump offering and clips through square leg. This outfield does not know friction
aha, similar ball but just a degree straighter, Porterfield ,i>nearly plays all over it as he tries to flick
shifts back to short of a length on off stukmp, 147.1 kph, Porterfield covers the line and defends

this innings has so far looked like the first morning of a Test match. Close-in fields, attacking bowling and sublime timing to beat the infield. Very fast from Roach again, looks for the stumps and ends up very full on leg stump, Porterfield has just waved his wand casually and send it through midwicket. Super shot.

oho, Pollard is down in a lot of pain. Driving length ball outside off, Porterfield plays the check drive with half the intent, straight to Pollard at point. He seems set to collect it, but the ball seemed to jump up, miss his hands and thud, slowly, but painfully, into the side of his knee. He's limping back up now.
full length ball on off stump, driven back confidently down the ground
fuller this time, Joyce is just waiting to drive through the off side. Played fluently but straight to cover
full length ball on leg stump, Joyce turns it away to midwicket
over-pitched on middle and leg, Joyce punches solidly but straight to mid on.
dangles the carrot outside off, trying to see if he wants to flash away from the body, but Joyce doesn't
fullish length on 125 kph and on off stump, Joyce defends to the off side. Quiet start to Sammy's spell.
full length ball to start off on off stump, defended solidly to the leg side
slow bustling action that takes pace as he runs in, 136 kph and very full again, punched confidently to mid on.
short delivery, for an instant, Porterfield seemed set to smash the pull shot out of Chandigarh as he got into position, but ended up mistiming it to fine leg for one
sharp bouncer, landed in Joyce's half and darting up close to the visor at 133 kph, was not very far from being called a wide for height.
teasing length outside off, Joyce opens the face after getting half across and steers straight to point

nice hands from Sarwan. Russell politely delivers a length ball, hoping short cover will come into play, and he does but not for the catch. Joyce crashes it on the bounce, into the ground, and Sarwan does well to stop it
comes off at 124 kph, far slower than Porterfield expected and he mistimes the on drive to mid on
Pollard saves some runs now, width for Porterfield who pounces on the cut and cracks it with good timing. Pollard runs to his left and dives to stop it.
short of a length on off stump, he gets behind the line and defends to the off side
short of a length again, Porterfield tries to dab to the off side, but it is too straight for the shot
aha, he's troubling them with his utter lack of pace, Porterfield tries to force a short of length ball outside off into the off side and gets a thick inside egde that misses the stumps. Closely
tight, intense stuff. On and around off stump all the time, one captain respects the other, covering the line and defending to the off side
length ball angling across Joyce who walks into the check drive to mid off
again, Russell is not giving much to drive, Ireland are settling down after all those boundaries. Joyce covers the line and defends to mid off again

timing. With a capital T, capital I, M and so on. Too good from Joyce. Russell for once drifts onto the pads, Joyce takes a step to his left to get inside the line and then clips it with consummate ease through midwicket. The ball just seemed to keep gathering momentum as it purred away
angry bouncer response, 133 kph and wafting away as Joyce is forced to arch back to safety

Sarwan's palms are taking a pounding at short cover. Two card trick from Russell, he tries the full ball outside off, and Joyce pounces on it almost ferociously. Timed immaculately and the ball is a blur until Sarwan comes in the way.
back of a length to end the over, Joyce plays it to the off side without intent to score

Sarwan has put it down. To be fair to him, it was more a case of the ball putting him down. He's standing really close in and these are some full blooded drives coming his way. Over-pitched by Sammy at a friendly pace and Porterfield drills it on the up straight at him. It thuds into the hands and bounces out as Sarwan winces in pain more than disappointment.
the ball is made of iron and Sarwan has a magnet in his hands. Another check drive to the off side, not hit that hard this time, goes straight to him
short of a length outside off, Porterfield steers with an opened face to the off side and again Sarwan fields
ah, there are other fielders on the ground. Porterfield plays a ball well outside off to backward point and Pollard fields
hmm, thickish outside edge as Porterfield tries to force a delivery on off stump. No damage done.
short of a length to end the over, and a very tight middle stump line. Porterfield punches on the up, but can't time it. Straight to cover.
short of a length and angling across Joyce who defends from the crease to the off side
this one ends up on middle stump and Joyce easily works it through square leg for a single
aha, length ball on the pads, Porterfield's intentions were right as he set up a solid base, opening up the leg side and looking to swipe it over square leg. Did not make contact though.
fuller length, he plays off the back foot and punches solidly into the covers

whoa, he's almost done a muscle going so hard at the pull. And almost did his helmet too. Short ball comes straight at him, but slower than he expected and it missed his fierce swish of the bat and clattered into the visor. Ouch. The helmet comes off, and the pink head needs a new piece of protection.
short of a length now, on off stump and defended cautiously to the off side. He has a new helmet by the way.
full delivery on the off stump, driven with good timing but straight to cover
shortens the length on off stump, Sammy just can't concede a run today, can he? Defended to the off side
again back of a length, this is nagging stuff at its nagging best. Joyce just defends to the off side from the crease
stop the press. No more maidens on the trot for Sammy, who has conceded a run. Joyce reaches across and opens the face to steer a single to third man
short of a length on off stump again, he's close to copyrighting this length. Defended from the crease to mid off

Sammy has nagged away like a hair stuck on the tongue that just will not come out, and Porterfield has spat out too hard, in the process losing his dentures. Or something like that. Sammy has strangled him out. Back of a length on middle and off, Porterfield thought it had to go and went for a heave over mid on. The length, as has been the case with Sammy so far today, was again not there for the drive. It pops up, hitting the bat closer to the handle than the sweet spot, and is easily taken at mid on
short of a length on the pads, clipped to midwicket for a single
a bouncer like he means it, Niall weaves away even as he ducks and looks the other way as the  bumper takes off and whizzes by
short of a length and angling across at 139 kph, Niall dabs with an angled face towards point
Niall has a single to start off, steering to third man as Russell again angles across him from leg stump line
fuller length, Niall is stuck on the crease and ends up playing it awkwardly off the backfoot into the off side

put your hands together for the shot of the day. And we have seen some shots today. Russell bounces him at 139 kph, it was headed for the helmet again, but Joyce has no problem swivelling onto the backfoot in one smooth motion and slamming the pull shot nearly all the way. Imperious and in front of square. Russell's hands are on his head, over the Mohawk hairdo.
full length outside off, Niall moves into a steer to point
back on the Sammy length, short of driving on off stump and defended with the full face
he squeezes the outside edge this time, Niall swishes away from the feet as he gets half forward and the edge flies to third man
angles across again, Joyce steers with control past the slip for a single
nicely done by Niall. Short ball, but not by much and he made up for the lack of room by generating timing with a forced short-arm jab. Benn is slow to run back and field, they get an easy couple
back of a length again on middle and leg, Niall looks to whip to the leg side but can't get it away.
over-pitched well outside off, and Joyce will feel he's missed out as he plays the cover drive straight to the fielder. Again, very good timing
short of a length on middle and leg, Joyce whips majestically off the hips but finds midwicket.
slower ball now, back of a length on off stump, defended off the front foot down the track
he just keeps timing them. Length ball on the pads and he powers it away past midwicket for another single. Joyce holds the key today.
back of a length, angling across Niall who dabs to the off side carefully

whack. Niall gets into the act with a furious carve as Russell offers a rare foot of width outside off. Niall doesn't exactly go back and across, he just stays beside the line and cuts hard and in front of square. Top placement.
fullish length on off stump, defended to cover point
on the pads, worked quietly to square leg

Niall is looking good too, with another punchy cut. Width on offer once again outside off, he gets half forward and cracks it away through cover point. Deep backward point seemed to have a chance, but  could not get around in time.
fuller length this time, on middle and off, driven on the up straight into the covers
expertly played, Sammy gets this one to come in a touch from outside off, and Niall guides it almost from the stumps to third man for one
ends the over with a fuller length, Joyce plays it calmly to covers and the players troop away for drinks.
full length ball on off stump to resume action, driven solidly into the covers
sprays this on the pads, worked easily off the pads through square leg
whoa, close stuff. Length ball on middle and off, Niall wasn't sure if he wanted to chip it in the air or keep the flick down. He managed to get just over the head of midwicket
aha, no ball from Russell, Niall defends to the off side. Now he'll have a go.
fullish ball on leg stump, Niall tries to hoick through the leg side, but the ball is too full for him to really muscle it. Single to the deep
looks to pull a short ball, it comes off the body and is a single towards third man
Joyce keeps strike by pushing a single into the covers to end the over
Joyce skips inside the line and clips a length ball on the pads through square leg for one
tight line, short of driving length just outside off and Niall can't connect with the forcing shot through the covers
he gets a single to third man, opening the face and steering expertly. Third man had to run fine in a hurry to stop that.
angles into the pads from round the wicket, Joyce eases him through square leg for one more

slow offcutter on off stump at 113 kph, defended with soft hands. Niall, then tries to tap the ball back at the bowler after it bounced. It did not go to Sammy on the bounce, but Thomas was on the verge of a loud appeal, just in case it did!
back of a length and angled across off stump to end the over, guided to backward point for one more
back of a length and turning in, a shaky defensive shot and half an appeal for lbw.
tossed up outside off, driven fluently into the covers, Niall picks up two more.
nice batting. Niall reaches out to smother the turn and dab into the covers for another single
Joyce stays inside the line and works a single to square leg.
loopy delivery onb the stumps, driven with the spin past Benn's outstreched boot and away for another single
short of a length on off stump to end the over, Niall leans out to smother the spin and defend down the track

they are using Sammy's speed and the fact that the keeper is standing up to their advantage. Length ball angling across and well outside off, Joyce reaches out and turns the bat to redirect it to third man
Niall steals a single now, defending the slow offcutter with soft hands to mid on and hustling across

Benn is probably the slowest fielder in this side, and Ireland know it. Joyce plays it straight to him at mid on, and by the time he makes his ungainly way to the ball, picks up and throws, they have a single
Thomas is too eager, he knocks the bails off even before the ball comes as Niall defends to the off side
this is top quality milking. Benn is pushed back to save the over, Niall chips a full ball on middle and leg in the air towards him and runs like the wind to get a couple.
slow offcutter on off stump to end the stump, Niall tries to force it away but can't time it
loopy ball on off, breaking in, defended down the track
Joyce skips out and gets to the pitch, he flicks with the spin to mid on
fired in faster on middle and leg, Joyce works it with the angle to midwicket
now he gets the single, short of a length delivery turning into middle and leg, driven down the ground for a single

ambitious lbw appeal? Or may be not. West Indies have referred it after Umpire Tarapore said not out. Flighted on off, appreciable drift for Benn as it lands and breaks it. Niall was pressing forward, but is struck in line with middle. The drift, though, has worked against his favour as the replay says it is going down the leg side.

Benn has struck a crucial blow, Niall departs. Again, its that uncanny loop and bounce he gets that made the difference. That, and Niall's decision to play inside the line and try the cheeky run down to third man. Short of a length and a hint of inward turn, not as much as the previous ball, Niall stayed back and looked to dab it fine, it missed the outer edge and hit off stump.
fastish length ball angling across, Joyce stays on the crease and works it straight to point
full on middle and off at 141.9 kph, Joyce plays it back down the track after a half stride forward

the blistering yorker at 145 kph, it is a Roach special, and credit to Joyce for managing to dig it out in line with off stump. Dust flies off the Mohali track as his bat jams down on the thunderbolt.
aha, the short ball, pacy and well directed, Joyce was taken aback and late on the pull. Luckily, the mistimed hit doesn't carry to the men on the deep in the leg side
yorker attempted alright, but Roach slips it a fraction too straight and Wilson helps it along to fine leg for four
real sharp stuff, 148.4 kph as it moves in from a length outside off stump. Wilson gets the inside edge as he fishes in a half-hearted manner, but it doesn't carry to the keeper
flighted on the stumps, driven down to long on for a single
Wilson drives a tossed up ball on off stump, daintily through the covers for another single

Pollard is in some real strife from that left knee. Speared onto the pads, Joyce nurdles round the corner for a quisk single. there was some confusion as Pollard sprawled after it, but he landed on the knee again and winced as he tried to get back up. He rubs the sore knee and gets ready for the next ball.
tossed up on off stump, driven against the spin to off side
another single for Wilson, steered backward of point for a single
Joyce opens the face and steers through the third man for another single
yorker from Roach, no holds barred, homing in on middle and leg, somehow defended to the off side
full length this time and a foot outside off, Wilson tries to play the square drive but the ball goes under the bat
length ball, solid defence from Wilson. Does look like Ireland want to play Roach out without taking risks.
short ball, comes into the body and Wilson controls the pull well down to deep square leg
length ball on leg stump, no room for Joyce to do much and he just plays it back down the track
Joyce keeps rolling, and so do his wrists. He flicks with minimal full through midwicket and gets another three before Sarwan from deep square leg can get across to tidy up
holds it back on off stump, Joyce skips out and clips to the left of the pitch. Aha, Benn and the non-striker get into a tangle. No friction though. Which is a surprise, since Benn is involved.
Joyce has his 50. This has been a fine hand, he leans out to the flight and dabs Benn calmly through point for one more.
short of a length and straightening from off stump, defended back down the track
again, Wilson plays Benn carefully from off stump line
shorter, but bigger turn away from outside off, and bounce. Wilson looks to cut and it bounces past his shot
ends with another defensive shot from the off stump line. Intense over that from Benn.
poor start from Pollard, lands a wafty offcutter well outside leg stump and concedes four down to fine leg as Joyce flicks
another poor ball, he slips well down the leg side and it is a wide
Joyce stays on the crease and opens the face to guide a single towards point
almost a yorker on off stump, Wilson crunches it back on the bounce to Pollard for a crowd catch.
length ball a foot or so outside off, Wilson slaps with decent timing, straight to cover
back of a length outside off, Wilson nurdles a single to third man with the angled face
hideous start to Pollard's spell. Over-pitched well outside off and Wilson outside-edges his attempted square drive. The ball runs away in double quick time to the third man boundary, very fine.
looped up on a length, Joyce leans out and defends
a hint of room outside off, Joyce defends off the back foot to the off side
nice little paddle, he gets inside the line and laps him across over fine leg side a couple
Joyce stays put on the crease and defends to the off side
opens the face this time, Joyce is completely untroubled by spin or pace. Another single in the third man region. If I had a dime everytime Ireland did that ...
Wilson plays with the spin into the off side, but can't place it
better ball from Pollard, lands the offcutter around middle and off, and Joyce can't connect with the guided drive to the off side

another shot manufactured out of nowehere, Joyce fashions room where there is none and cuts through point. Benn is languid as a giraffe having its afternoon snooze as he gets the foot down and fields, if you can use that word, on the boundary

good thing West Indies have replaced Benn with Russell at deep point, else this was going to be four. Another controlled cut from Joyce finer this time and Russell does well to slide and save the boundary
fuller length on off stump, Joyce drives with the full face past the bowler for another single
short of a length, offcutter angles in from very wide of the crease and Wilson defends
enough width here for the forcing shot through the off side, but Wilson plays it straight to cover
Miller turns it into the pads, Joyce clips through midwicket for another single

Wilson jumps out of the crease, with the kind of consummate ease displayed by Eoin Morgan in Chittagong. Gets to the flight of the ball and drives with lovely touch through the covers. Aha, Benn partly redeems his fielding efforts with a clean pick up and throw from deep midwicket
Wilson plays him down the ground for another single. They are rolling along ...
hmm, stifled lbw appeal as Miller turns it back in, but Joyce was pushing outside the line and got bat on it.
Wilson opens the face and steers a single through point

Dropped! This could be the turning point of the game. Time was suspended for a moment or two in Mohali. Miller slowed it up in the air, got it to dip slowly as Joyce jumped out with glee at a full toss. He ended up getting too close to the ball and hitting it straight back, quite softly at the bowler. It came so slowly that Miller jumped up in slow motion, and ended up hitting his peak long before the ball came, comfortably at chest height. It was so blindingly obviously an easy catch .. that he managed to put it down.
single for Wilson, reaches out to a fullish ball and plays down the ground for one
Joyce keeps nurdling them around, clipping square for one more
Wilson square drives a full and wide delivery, past point for one more
Joyce leans into a cracking cover drive on the full ball outside off and sends it hurtling through the covers for a couple.
and another single, clipped through the leg side for a single
Wilson defends a full ball to the off side
he leans out to a full ball on the stumps and defends down the track
panic in the Windies ranks! Joyce is looking truly unstoppable. Short ball alright, and turning into him, he opens up the leg side and goes big over midwicket.
he clips him with the spin this time for another single
Wilson plays a cheeky little paddle dab, as the ball turns away from off stump, he puts his front foot across and laps him over
Joyce tries to time the cover drive but can't get it off the square this time
quickish delivery on off stump, Wilson plays it to the off side and seeks a single.
fuller length on off stump, Joyce digs it out with the toe end of the bat towards mid off
nicely done by Russell on the follow through. Length ball angling across, Joyce hangs back and punches to the leg side, Russell stops, moves quickly to the leg side, slides and saves
Joyce moves across to off stump, and looks to flick to the leg side, but there is no room for muscle in the shot this time
shorter this time tight line on middle and leg, and Joyce is unusually subdued this over as he clips to the leg side without intent

seemed risky when he played it, but knowing how well Joyce has calibrated his shots so far, it was probably intended. Driving length and angling across, Joyce stayed on leg stump to give himself room and drove in workman-like fashion. Played airily and not too far from the man at short extra cover. But he gets it past him and it is four more
tossed up and turning away, played with the spin into the covers
tighter linje on off stump, Wilson defends sedately to the off side
he jumps out this time and Miller holds the length back, played to the leg side without much timing
pressure on Wilson who can't get it away, plays a fullish ball down the track without timing
he finally gets it away, driving with the spin through extra cover just for a single
Joyce drives with the spin through long on and crucially, keeps the strike

whoa Benn. He's surprised himself with a superb save at third man. Joyce jumps to the leg side, runs back to middle and leg and gets a full toss outside off that he outside edges to third man. It seemed set for four unless a seemingly carthweeling Benn came in the way.
Wilson can't turn the strike, back of a length on off stump and defended to the off side
back of a length outside off stump, nurdled backward of square for a single
slower ball on off stump, he waits for the offcutter to break away and dabs gently to the off side for one

whoa, haven't seen too much off this before. Russell seemed to be pulling out of the delivery stride when he was like two steps away from the crease. And then inexplicably he got back into his stride and actually bowled the ball! Wilson plays it into the covers, amazingly, he wasn't distracted by the charade.
full on the stumps, Wilson drives straight to mid on. He's lost his timing, and hopefully will regain it during the drinks break, which is now.
speared into the pads, clipped with the spin through square leg for one
Wilson still can't get it off the square. Hmm. He drives a full ball on stump on off stump back at the bowler
he gets a single now, jumping out and carving over the covers inside out
Joyce keeps ticking along, hangs back and bunts a single down to long on as it turns in
huge appeal for lbw, turned down though. Looked like Miller turned it too much and it would have missed off as a result. Wilson went for a sweep and missed.

Wilson has hit Miller out of Mohali. A slog sweep that would have made Steve Waugh proud. He plonks his front foot across the line, gets a nice juicy length from Miller and hauls it with the angle before it can turn away. Huge blow.

urgency in the air, Joyce jumps out of the crease and gets a short ball from Russell that leaves him fending an uppish pull to the leg side. He managed to get it away safely for a single through square leg

Wilson has had enough of the scratching and is going after everything. He backs away, prances out and cuts uppishly over the covers. Enough time for a catch to be taken in the outfield, but there was no one to take it.
yorker on the pads, just missed its spot and Wilson calmly flicks to deep midwicket. Was that Pollard in the deep? Top effort running across from deep square leg to save the boundary
Joyce is cramped for room and length by Russell and works it off the hips to the leg side
yorker at 141 kph, but Joyce is seeing it so well, he actually plays a proper flick from the middle and off line. Can't get the midwicket gap though
Russell deals exclusively in yorkers. Joyce defends cautiously down the track to end the over
Wilson has taken off after the drinks alright. Miller spears another one on the pads and he calmly paddles him along to fine leg. 111 off 83.

Wilson runs down the track, gets to the pitch and whips expertly from off stump, and purposely without timing to midwicket. Soft hands and hard running. The perfect middle-overs recipe. These Associates know how to play alright!

Ladies and gentlemen. Say it in hushed tones. An upset is on the cards. Tossed up outside off, Wilson jumps around, shifts his stance and reverse paddles him in a manner so comfortable that aliens, if they are watching, will think it is one of the most common shots in the game.
and again! Just for fun, he plays it in a more violent manner this time. Miller spears it shorter and on middle and off, Wilson smacks the reverse sweep squarer this time
4,4,0. He had 8 off the previous two balls, so just like that he decided to block this one.
and a couple more, he flicks away as if he's dealing with Mohali mosquitoes and gets two to deep midwicket
Russell lands it full on leg stump, Joyce clips straight to midwicket
needless improvisation in hindsight, Joyce backs away too far and can't get bat on a ball well outside off

Rusell has bowled the ball of the day. He then jumps up four feet in the air, throws his right arm up with finger pointed upwards. He's thrilled and he should be, since he has bowled a dream yorker. Delivers from slightly wide of the crease, and it snakes through the air around middle and leg, past Joyce's attempt to flick off the toes, and makes a mess of the timber behind him as he plays all around it. Collective sighs of relief being heaved in the Caribbean. However, there is a KOB to content with. And a batting PP.
sharp bouncer at 133.7 kph, curves into the line of middle and leg as KOB ducks
this one comes off slower, KOB is early on the push into the covers and plays uppishly to the left of the bowler
aha, he's hit KOB on the ribs. KOB is in some pain as he misses a pull and takes it on the side. Russell's ended a fine debut spell in some style here.
slower ball on off stump on 119 kph, Wilson hangs back and dabs through backward point for a single. A shy at the stumps though the keeper was imploring him not to have a go.
and he nearly makes it 2-0 with a deceptive legcutter that KOB was years too early on and scooped up. Somehow it lands safely on the leg side of the pitch
Wilson moves to 49, getting forward and dinking a single to the leg side
KOB gets inside the line and gets a leg bye away as he misses the flick
Wilson has 50, and he's really shifted gears since drinks. He stays put on middle and leg and steers quietly through point for one
KOB is not picking Pollard's slower ones at all. 103 kph on this wafter that comes off at a dawdle and KOB inside edges the cover drive, past the stumps for a single

and nearly has a wicket first ball. Short ball angling into the body, KOB packs his biceps into a power pull that nearly picks out Russell at deep midwicket. Russell misfields, allows a second, which was anyway on. And still KOB barely makes his ground. He really runs like a snail.
he stays on the back foot and forces through wide mid on for another run.
good work from Russell this time, 96.4 kph and angling into the pads, Wilson clips backward of square and thinks of two. Russell is quickly onto it.

Pollard 2 - KOB 0. And it may well be the ball that makes it West Indies 2 - Ireland 0. Shades of Ajay Jadeja catching Allan Border in the 1992 World Cup, according to Sriram Veera. Length ball coming in with the angle, KOB tries to get under it and dump it over long on, but ends up scooping it higher rather than far. Pollard runs in from the deep, with a dodgy knee mind you. He dives forrward. He is one with the turf as he plucks it with his hands in front of him. He stands up, and he roars.
Wilson stays back on the crease and calmly defends down the track. This is all down to him now.

that's pretty much as bad as a slower ball can go. Ends up as a lollypopp full toss on off stump. Wilson sees it, picks his spot, counts a few sheep, pinches himself, and then dumps it through midwicket.
slow yorker outside off, 116 kph and Cusack tries to jam it to third man.
full again, on the pads and Cusack clips it airily through midwicket for a single
Pollard is bowling as slowly as he bats fast. 107 kph offcutter on off and plays without timing into the covers

go Wilson go. Slower ball on off stump, he spots it late and just decides to carry on with the cover drive. The lack of indecision helped, he timed it well enough to go over the infield and it ran away to the extra cover fence
another legcutter, shorter this time and Wilson will be disappointed he could not place the steer finer than short third man.
taps a single, hangs on the crease and plays it into the covers softly for one more
back of a length on off stump, forced into the off side for a single
Cusack takes a nervy single, Sammy curves it in the air and he manages to dig it out to the leg side for one
again Sammy gets that big inward movement and traps him in front of middle and leg. Surely going down the leg side, even Asoka de Silva says not out.

Sammy might have done it for WI. LBW appeal given and referred. This seemed adjacent. Or did it? Sammy lands this outside off and moves it in off the seam. Wilson has pushed outside the line and gets the pad outside the line. Wilson should be safe. Or is he? Asoka, as always has a surprise up his sleeve. He says the original decision stays. Wilson is flabbergasted after seeing the replay on the giant screen, and implored Asoka to check again. He was offering some kind of a shot at it, the late dab that he's played all day. Asoka is unmoved. Sammy puts an arm on Wilson's shoulder, but can't calm the agitated Wilson. Eventually Asoka checks again upstairs. And in the end, after a review of the review of the original call, he's given it out. UDRS continues to confound. Asoka apparently thought Wilson wasn't playing a shot. If Wilson wasn't playing a shot there, then I am Bill Gates.
Mooney is the new man in, plays a full ball to the off side.
Mooney lets the last ball go through to the keeper. End of an awesome spell from Sammy. Two wickets to him. And one to Asoka. Or possibly the third umpire who relayed the information.
full length ball on off stump, he can't get it away

Cusack is gone and the chances of an upset have receded considerably. Full yorker on middle stump, he plays all over it as he jumps out and looks to flick. The ball bursts through the defences to Thomas who fumbles and tumbles, but has enough time to regain the ball and break the stumps. Cusack never made it back in, he was in a shambles of his own down the track.
flattish delivery on off stump from over the wicket, he gets behind the line and defends down the track
turning into the pads, flicked through square leg for a single
fires it in quick and fast, down the leg side for a wide
Benn is a yorker expert of sorts. Toe-tickler on middle and off, dug out down the track for no runs
length ball angling across the left hander who laces the cover drive to deep cover for one. They need more than singles. And they need a miracle.
a stunner of a yorker, on leg stump at 146.8 kph, a scream of dust as Botha hurriedly moves his feet out of the firing line and plays it to the leg side
he keeps it full again, Botha digs it out to mid off. Another dot ball. This is tragic for Ireland.

Sammy, take a bow. Botha digs out a full ball outside off straight to Sammy at mid off. He takes off in a feeble effort for a single. Sammy picked the ball, ran in a step, lined up a throw, ran in some more, lined up again, and threw the stumps down at the bowler's end.
misses the line a touch, 138 kph and a low fulltoss going down the leg side, clipped backward of square leg for one
full toss on middle and off, and it is clocked at 151.8 kph since it doesn't have to deal with the decelerating effects of friction. Played away to the off side
full and fast outside off, no way a tail-ender is going to get that away
Dockrell, who mysteriously did not bowl more than 3 overs today, is away with a single as he drives into the off side
top shot from Mooney who uses all off Benn's pace to reverse lap a boundary. Benn landed it on a length outside off and he sent it scurrying at the same speed to third man.
another low full delivery on off, Mooney digs it out to mid on for a single
Dockrell manages to get bat on ball and steer to the off side, but no single to be had.
109 kph, full toss on middle and off. Here's the fastest spinner in the world after Shahid Afridi. Dockrell forces into the covers for one
sharp bouncer, ambitious attempt at an upper dab from Dockrell and it is through him in no time
another short ball, closer to off stumps and Dockrell again misses the steered guide to third man
Roach attempts the fullish slower ball, and Dockrell is ready after spotting the variation. He lofts it cleanly, on the up over the covers
aha, short delivery again, Dockrell hops away to keep his body intact and then manages to angle it with the pace of the bowler to third man for one

Roach keeps delivering these thunderbolt yorkers, and the tail-enders don't stand a chance at all. Mooney tried to make room by moving to the leg side, Roach calmly followed him and banged his boots hard. The ball ricocheted onto the stumps and that's the end of Mooney.
yorkers at 152 kph. Batsmen watching on TV will be happy they aren't facing up. Rankin miraculously gets bat on it down to third man.
speared onto middle and leg at 92 kph, dabbed to the leg side for a single
Benn classically flights this one up and Dockrell defends into the covers carefully

ah, Dockrell gets four as Benn again tosses one up. What next? The bouncer? This time, Dockrell leans out to the flight and lofts it with finesse over the covers. Russell, running back, has rammed into the advertising boards after failing to stop it. He is now down, clutching the hamstring in pain. Substitute comes on.,
fired in on off, Dockrell digs it out to the off side
Dockrell steals another four, this must be really riling Benn up. Driving length outswide off, Dockrell steers it expertly this time and all the fielders square on the off side are inside the circle
Dockrell jumps out with confidence and plays all around a loopy ball on middle and off.

141 kph bouncer that blitzes past a weaving Rankin. He barely saw it. Meanwhile, England are collapsing in a heap in the batting Powerplay. They should ask for the batting Powerplay to be canceled while they bat.
back of a lengght and pacy again, Rankin plays it down the track unconvincingly
yorker at 144 kph on off stump, Rankin almost looks proud that he managed to keep it out
slower ball, served up at 114 kph on the leg stump, flicked to the leg side for a single
and now a bouncer at 144 kph. Roach is exactly the kind of bowler the West Indies have looked for since Walsh and Ambrose left. Dockrell stays out of harms way, and Thomas' gloves take a pounding.
he gets a single this time, dinking a single through backward point for one. He will now resume his battle of the slow left armers, with Benn.
tossed up on off, driven solidly to Pollard at long off for a single
full toss on off stump as Rankin advances and he dabs into the covers for a single
who's bowling the better yorkers - Benn or Roach? On middle stump at 108 kph, and somehow dug out to short fine leg for one
another one, looking to uproot the stumps, somehow Rankin keeps it out
short of a length outside off, he looks to dab it fine but can't get it away

all over, after all those yorkers, Benn has got a wicket with orthodox left-arm spin. Tossed up delicately on middle and off, allowing it to dip on Dockrell who reaches out and swipes. He doesn't make contact as the ball grips and breaks past him. Off stump is disturbed on the way. Ireland are bowled out.
